text:
A Cold Wall Drops Brand New NikeLab Air Force One Collaboration at London Fashion Week Men’s January 7, 2017 4:45 pm Vogue may earn compensation on these sales through affiliate programs. See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: Photo: Courtesy of A Cold Wall See more photos of: 
Last night, A Cold Wall—the burgeoning London-based streetwear brand helmed by Virgil Abloh/Off-White protégé Samuel Ross—unveiled a brand new, sneaker blog-stirring collaboration at its Fall 2017 presentation: fully customized NikeLab Air Force Ones. 
The evening also marked Ross’s debut on the London Fashion Week Men’s calendar, and while the longish, androgynous clothes held points of merit in their own rights, the shoes were the night’s big talking point. “Let’s call it a bespoke experiment,” said Ross, “because the shoe has been altered quite heavily—we took away the eyelets, stripped off the tick, and embroidered on the spot. They never do these things.” Expand Photo: Eva Al Desnudo 
The result is a somewhat experimental looking sneaker, with A Cold Wall’s angular textual logo sewn on the outer edge of the foot, as well as the tongue. “A Cold Wall and Nike individually offer unique, innovative, and curated products that celebrate design culture as much as street culture,” added Ross. “It’s a tangible conversation.” 
The shoes were made solely for the show—but, we imagine, Ross might rethink that decision and put them into production if demand is strong enough.
